channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Inside Museums
channel.desc: Lachlan Goudie relates paintings at the Scottish National Gallery to our lives today.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Meet the Ancestors
channel.desc: Life on the WWI front line is pieced together as archaeologists unearth a complex trench system, military hardware and personal artefacts near Ypres.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Anthony Hopkins
channel.desc: A look back at the life of Oscar-winning actor Sir Anthony Hopkins, featuring interviews conducted with the BBC over the course of his career.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Remains of the Day
channel.desc: Mr Stevens, formerly the butler to the German sympathiser Lord Darlington, gets a letter from former colleague Miss Kenton.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Letter to Brezhnev
channel.desc: Two Liverpool lasses hook up with a pair of Soviet sailors, but the night turns serious. Contains strong language and some scenes of a sexual nature.

channel.title: Anthony Hopkins

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Making of King Arthur
channel.desc: Simon Armitage traces the evolution of the Arthurian legend through the literature of the medieval age and reveals that King Arthur is not the great national hero we think he is.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Eurythmics at the BBC
channel.desc: A collection of Eurythmics' best moments from the BBC's music archives, showcasing the bold, innovative, stylish and unpredictable pair who became one of Britain's biggest bands of the 1980s.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Annie Lennox at the BBC
channel.desc: Annie Lennox has been described as the most successful female artist in British music history, and this collection is a celebration of the stunning solo side of her accomplishments.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Annie Lennox
channel.desc: Annie Lennox performs a selection of hits from her solo career and her Eurythmics days, including Here Comes the Rain, Sweet Dreams and Little Bird, from LSO St Luke's in London.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Annie Lennox
channel.desc: Documentary that first aired in 1992, featuring an in-depth interview with the ex-Eurythmics singer as well as an extensive selection of archive footage.

channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: Siegfried befriends Colin when one of his goldfish dies, and takes him on his rounds. James is in the team for the local cricket match, but Siegfried hits a six.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
channel.desc: Fred looks at the industrial expansion of the 18th century and the use of steam engines in mills, collieries and steelworks.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power
channel.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores London, the ultimate 'city of villages', including a new breed of urban villages like Crouch End and Walthamstow.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Dance Passion Bradford
channel.desc: In a fusion of rhythm and pride, dancers from ballet to Bhangra, artistic swimming to Kathak, take over the city of culture's streets to celebrate the joy of dance.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Matthew Bourne Remembers... Swan Lake
channel.desc: Acclaimed choreographer and director Sir Matthew Bourne discusses his groundbreaking reinterpretation of Tchaikovsky's classic ballet Swan Lake.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Matthew Bourne
channel.desc: Director and choreographer Matthew Bourne's radical reworking of Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake. The score remains the same, but the famous corps de ballet is now danced by men.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Age of Uncertainty
channel.desc: JK Galbraith looks at the influence of John Maynard Keynes, who drew the blueprint for the postwar economic boom, and recalls his own involvement in those momentous years.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Age of Uncertainty
channel.desc: JK Galbraith visits the ruins of postwar Berlin, the corridors of power in the Pentagon and 'the world's largest used plane lot' in his assessment of the contemporary roots of war.

channel.desc: After years of telling the story of Christian art, Sister Wendy Beckett tells her own.[(96057)]
